TIME OF DAY FRACTURE OCCURRED:  Other, specify
DEATH OCCURED DURING HIP FRACTURE HOSPITALIZATION:
DETAILED CIRCUMSTANCES OF HIP FRACTURE:
column17: 1 = Fall from standing height or less-includes most injuries due to tripping over something, slips in the shower or bathtub, or falling out of a chair or bed (unless standing on it), in which the participant lands on the surface at the same height as the surface he/she was standing on
column18: 2 = Falls on stairs, steps or curbs-includes all falls during change of level, such as stepping up or down stairs, steps, or curbs
column19: 3 = Fall from more than standing height, but NOT on stairs-includes falls from heights such as off a ladder or while standing on a table or chair, off a porch, out of a window, etc.
column20: 4 = Minimal trauma other than a fall-includes vertebral fractures associated with coughing, stepping down a step, etc., and rib or other fractures associated with turning over in bed, etc.
column21: 5 = Moderate trauma other than a fall-includes collisions with objects during normal activities (e.g. stub toe, hit hand against door frame, walking into door), twisting or turning ankle (or ankle fractures).
column22: 6 = Severe trauma other than a fall-includes motor vehicle accidents, struck by a car, hit by rapidly moving projectile (golf ball, golf club), assault
column23: 7 = Pathologic fracture-usually associated with cancer in bone
